key_title: Key to the species of Festuca

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaf-blades involute, often terete, less than 1 mm wide
Leaf-blades flat or channelled, 2–20 mm wide
Leaf-blades scabrous to shortly hispid (rarely smooth), sheath glabrous; lemma (excluding awn) 6–9 mm long
Leaf-blades smooth (occasionally minutely scabrous near the tips), sheath minutely pubescent; lemma (excluding awn) 4–6 mm long
Plants smooth on culms, smooth to lightly scabrous on leaves and nerves of lemma; mostly wetter sites in the lowlands
Plants conspicuously scabrous on culms, leaves and lemma; rocky subalps
